title: Phone number in profile does not save or display after entering it
body:
The Phone Number when entered in the Profile page does not display after entering or revisiting the page.

**To Reproduce**

1. Navigate to the profile page after logging in (/Account/Manage)
2. Enter a phone number in the phone number field
3. Click Save

**Expected behavior**

* The message "Your profile has been updated" should appear and the phone number should be displayed
* Upon subsequent visits to the page the phone number the user entered should be displayed

**Actual behavior**

* The message "Your profile has been updated" is displayed but the phone number just shows the placeholder text "Phone number"

title: Text editor text alignment

title: Grant roles / permissions to users
body:
We should define some initial roles for SharpSite and allow administrators to assign those to users:

- [ ] System Admin
- [ ] Editor
- [ ] Writer

A system admin can do anything on the application

An editor cannot change application configuration, but can read / write any and all content

A writer can only read / write posts
author: csharpfritz

comments.body:
A common approach to this can be done by making a Role a collection of CRUD operations. For example:
- System Admin - `User` CRUD
- Editor, Writer - `User`  RUD self, R other
- None - `User` C

Then gates for `getOtherUser(id)` can check that the asking session's user has "R" perm for other users (likely through middleware or something)

title: Consider pinning the version of the Postgres containers
body: In the .NET Aspire configuration, it might be a good practice to explicitly declare the version of Postgres that we're working with so that all libraries and data written to disk is compatible
author: csharpfritz

comments.body:
Just leaving this here as a research note I just discovered:

I upgraded my own solution to .NET 9 and found out that the DataVolume created by the WithDataVolume method is bound to the Postgres version.
So as my app isn't in my production anyway I ended up versioning the data volume: app-datavolume-pgv16 (pgv16: Postgres Version 16).
